Data Entry Personnel The Data Entry Personnel human actor is the health worker responsible for entering in health event data into a Point of Care system under retrospective data entry.
National Public Key Directory (NPKD) The National Public Key Directory system actor is a national public key directory which shares the public keys used within the Member State's jurisidiction.
WHO Public Key Directory (WHO-PKD) The WHO Public Key Directory system actor is a quality-controlled, global master list of public keys, revocation lists, and internet endpoints that operationalize the trust network between Member Statesâ€™ PHAs.
Point of Care The Point of Care system actor is responsible for recording vaccination events either during a clinical encounter by a Vaccinator or during retrospective data entry by a Data Clerk. It is recommended that the Point of Care system actor should:
be authorized by the Public Health Authority to record vaccination events
establish that the Vaccinator is authorized by the Public Health Authority to perform the requested vaccinations
DDCC Generator The DDCC Generator system actor is responsible for signing Digital Documentation of COVID-19 Certificates and delivering these to the approriate system actors. Specifically the DDCC Generator should receving health event content from a Point of Care system and:
generate a signed QR code representing the health event and returning to the Point of Care system
generate a signed FHIR Document representing the health event and registering it with the DDCC Registry Service
DDCC Holder The DDCC Holder human actor represents the person who is responsible for holding the the DDCC on behalf of the Subject of Care. The DDCC Holder may or may not be the same actor as teh Subject of Care.
DDCC Registry Service The DDCC Registry Service system actor is reponsible for recording registration of a Smart Health Certificate and supporting future retrieval or verification of Smart Health Certificates.
Subject of Care The Subject of Care human actor is the primary subject of the health event being recording in the DDCC.
Vaccinator The Vaccinator human actor is the health worker that performs the vaccination. The Vaccinator may, though is not required to, record vaccination event data into the Point of Care system during a clinical encounter.
Verfier The Verifier human actor verifies a claim represented by a Smart Health Certificate.
